metadata.name: Suspicious Cabinet File Execution Via Msdt.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects execution of msdt.exe using the "cab" flag which could indicates suspicious diagcab files with embedded answer files leveraging CVE-2022-30190

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\msdt.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('msdt.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -cab ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /cab ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' –cab ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' —cab ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ―cab '))))

output.summary: Detects execution of msdt.exe using the "cab" flag which could indicates suspicious diagcab files with embedded answer files leveraging CVE-2022-30190

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage of ".diagcab" files References: https://twitter.com/nas_bench/status/1537896324837781506, https://github.com/GossiTheDog/ThreatHunting/blob/e85884abbf05d5b41efc809ea6532b10b45bd05c/AdvancedHuntingQueries/DogWalk-DiagCab, https://github.com/elastic/protections-artifacts/commit/746086721fd385d9f5c6647cada1788db4aea95f#diff-9015912909545e72ed42cbac4d1e96295e8964579c406d23fd9c47a8091576a0, https://irsl.medium.com/the-trouble-with-microsofts-troubleshooters-6e32fc80b8bd
